intro: Stypandra jamesii, commonly known as the James' stypandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has a creeping rootstock that allows it to spread along the ground. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, spicy scent when crushed, while its flowers are white to pale green and bloom in late spring. Stypandra jamesii is often found in shaded environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
